ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Adobe Green Project. AHSWME Project. Rain Water Harvesting. Campaign Against Burning of Leaves. Herbal Plants. Vermi Composting.

sourceOfFunds.purpose: During the year 2017-18 no grant has been received from overseas organisation. But remaining grant of AHSWME project was utilized and Rs. 529261 were spent on the execution of the remaining part of the project.

The projects initiated by Citizens Environment Improvement Society, Noida with the financial support of Adobe Foundation and facilitated by Give to Asia and CAF. The project was aimed to prevent burning of leaves and create awareness among the citizens of Noida against burning of leaves. The project was initiated with interaction with RWAs, Corporate, Schools and Hospitals of Noida for setting up vermi composting facilities, and creating awareness in masses through campaigning/demonstrating.

Breakdown of grants received from Adobe Systems through Charity Aid Foundation (Rs. 490970/, IBM India Pvt Ltd (Rs 55000) and Ms Sanika Kulshreshta (Rs 29668). The grants were utilized for Campaign Against Burning of Leaves and Adobe Green Project and GAYE Project.

The project AHSWME was aimed to train and sensitize 1500 school children in proper management of solid waste. The challenge was to make the younger generation in schools aware about the problems arising due to solid waste that existed around us and to educate and train them to manage their waste in a hygienic and scientific manner. The approach was to motivate them to reduce, reuse, recycle and segregate their waste. The awareness and training was imparted through interactions and practicals.

ngoList.detailsOfAchievement: Developed a globally recognised community-based model for saving newborn lives, Behaviour Change Management framework for newborn survival, Developed a model for community and health system-based scale-up of life-saving Kangaroo Mother Care for low birth weight infants, Epidemiological methods for estimating the burden of maternal, newborn deaths and stillbirths, Early child development assessment and interventions

sourceOfFunds.purpose: India has a tradition of massaging newborn infants with natural oils. It has been found in hospital based studies that sunflower oil can improve survival in premature infants. We wanted to assess if massaging newborns with sunflower seed oil can also improve newborn survival in community settings. WHO is FCRA exempt UN organisation. Please see https://fcraonline.nic.in/home/PDF_Doc/FCRA-exemptedAgenciesUN.pdf

Kangaroo Mother Care (KMC) is a life-saving natural practice of holding a baby in skin-to-skin contact with the mother. It can prevent >1.5 lakh newborn deaths in the country, if provided to all low birth weight infants.Based on the innovations developed in this project, KMC has been scaled up to 174 public health facilities. WHO is FCRA exempt UN organisation. Please see https://fcraonline.nic.in/ho

DEHAT is Operating 60 free of cost Alternative Education Support Centres for 1878 out of school girls in Bahraich and Shrawasti districts of UP. All these girls are given free of cost books, copies, all kind of learning materials etc. and we educate these girls upto 5th class. After 5th class, we facilitate them to continue education towards higher classes. For ensuring quality, we appoint only female teachers and provide them 20 days residential training on teaching skills.
